intro: Gymnosporia fasiculata, commonly known as the African firethorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, bright yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals but toxic to humans. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gymnosporia fasiculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
